SEARCH
Package inf101.grid

Class Grid<T>

java.lang.Object
inf101.grid.Grid<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGrid<T>, Iterable<T>
public class Grid<T> extends Object implements IGrid<T>
A Grid contains a values in a 2D rectangular layout.

  • Constructor Details

    • Grid

      public Grid(int width, int height, Function<Location,T> initialiser)
      Construct a grid with the given dimensions.

      The initialiser function will be called with the (x,y) position of an element, and is expected to return the element to place at that position. For example: 

       // fill all cells with the position as a string (e.g., "(2,2)")
 new Grid(10, 10, ((x, y) -> String.format("(%d,%d)", x, y));
      Parameters:
      width -
      height -
      initialiser - The initialiser function

    • Grid

      public Grid(int width, int height, T initElement)
      Construct a grid with the given dimensions.
      Parameters:
      width -
      height -
      initElement - What the cells should initially hold (possibly null)

    • set

      public void set(Location loc, T elem)
      Description copied from interface: IGrid
      Set the contents of the cell in the given x,y location.

      y must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getHeight(). x must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getWidth().

      Specified by:
      set in interface IGrid<T>
      Parameters:
      loc - The (x,y) position of the grid cell to get the contents of.
      elem - The contents the cell is to have.

    • checkLocation

      public void checkLocation(Location loc)
      This method checks if a given Location is within the bounds of this grid. If it is not, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      loc - the location to check

    • isOnGrid

      public boolean isOnGrid(Location loc)
      Description copied from interface: IGrid
      Check if coordinates are valid.

      Valid coordinates are 0 invalid input: '<'= pos.getX() invalid input: '<' getWidth(), 0 invalid input: '<'= pos.getY() invalid input: '<' getHeight().

      Specified by:
      isOnGrid in interface IGrid<T>
      Parameters:
      loc - A position
      Returns:
      true if the position is within the grid

      public T get(Location loc)
      Description copied from interface: IGrid
      Get the contents of the cell in the given x,y location.

      y must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getHeight(). x must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getWidth().

      Specified by:
      get in interface IGrid<T>
      Parameters:

    • locations

      public GridLocationIterator locations()
      Description copied from interface: IGrid
      Iterate over all grid locations

      See also Iterable.iterator() – using the grid directly in a for-loop will iterate over the elements.

      All locations obtained through the iterator are guaranteed to be valid according to

      invalid reference 
      #isValid(ILocation)
      .
      Specified by:
      locations in interface IGrid<T>
      Returns:
      An iterable for iterating over all the locations in the grid

    • fillCopy

      public void fillCopy(Grid<T> newGrid)

    • fill

      public void fill(Function<Location,T> initialiser)
      Description copied from interface: IGrid
      Initialise the contents of all cells using an initialiser function.

      The function will be called with the (x,y) position of an element, and is expected to return the element to place at that position. For example: 

       // fill all cells with the position as a string (e.g., "(2,2)")
 grid.setAll((x, y) -> String.format("(%d,%d)", x, y));
      Specified by:
      fill in interface IGrid<T>
      Parameters:
      initialiser - The initialiser function

    • fill

      public void fill(T element)
      Description copied from interface: IGrid
      Set the contents of all cells to element

      For example: 

       // clear the grid
 grid.setAll(null);
      Specified by:
      fill in interface IGrid<T>

    • locationOf

      public Location locationOf(Object obj)
      Finds the location containing a given object. If no such object has been found, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      obj - - the Object to find.
      Returns:
      A Location loc such that get(loc).equals(obj) is true;
